creator: stefanfuhrmann@alice-dsl.de
text:
Current Visual Studio compilers fail to replace the
ROTATE_LEFT macro with a rotl machine instruction.
The attached patch tells VS what to do.

[[[
Save a couple of cycles on MD5 compiled with newer
Microsoft compilers (VS2003 ff.).

* crypt/apr_md5.c
  (ROTATE_LEFT): tell newer Microsoft compilers to 
  replace this macro with a single machine instuction.

patch by stefanfuhrmann < at > alice-dsl.de
]]]

creator: ivan@apache.org
text:
It seems that it's fixed in newer compiler. Below is the snippet of code generated by Visual C++ 2015:
//    GG(c, d, a, b, x[11], S23, 0x265e5a51); /* 19 */
not         ecx  
rol         edx,9  
and         ecx,esi  
add         edx,esi  
mov         eax,edx  
and         eax,edi  
or          ecx,eax  
mov         eax,dword ptr [block]  
add         ecx,265E5A51h  
add         ecx,dword ptr [eax+2Ch]  
add         ebx,ecx  


So the issue could be marked as RESOLVED.

creator: stefan2@apache.org
text: The new compilers can figure it out by themselves; no need to fix this for older compilers.
